result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael L Turrittin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Sex with Child Age 16 or Older [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.09.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Michael L Turrittin
parties.address: 1105 Pennsylvania St, RETURNED-FWD TIME EXPIRED-NOT AT FWD, Sturgeon Bay, WI 54235

parties.name: Door County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: Pay $250 fine plus costs. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Maintain full time employment and/or school.
No contact direct or indirect with victim or her family. No unsupervised contact with juveniles. Supervisor would have to be approved by Dept. of Corrections.
Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment. Write minimum 250 word apology to victim.

timeConds.notes:
30 days of sentence are stayed to be used at discretion of Court through petition by Dept. of Corrections. Huber privileges granted. 60 days to report.

5/2/17 Court lifts stay. 60 days to begin April 26, 2017. 
5/5/17 Court grants Huber privileges on 30 days on which stay was lifted.

supervisions.notes:
Good time and Huber privileges granted. 30 days to report.

4/5/18 Court agrees to 7 additional days of credit as outlined in ADA's letter of 4/5/18.
Outstanding financial obligations are reduced to civil judgment. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

records.descr: Amended Judgment of Conviction After Revocation

records.addlTxt: for Sentence Modification from Defendant - Per Court, approved. Agree to 7 days of credit as outlined in ADA's letter of 4/5/18.
State's Response to Defendant's Request for Sentence Modification
for Sentence Modification. Per Court, revoke 30 days to Huber/work release privilege.
Left voice mail on phone number listed for Defendant on his letter advising that request had been denied and that he would have to report as ordered.
Letter from State Objecting to Defendant's Request for Extension of Time. Per Court, I have seen this.
from Defendant requesting extension of time to report. Per Court, Request denied. Must report as ordered.

Defendant Michael L Turrittin in court, in custody. Nicholas Grode appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court questions Defendant regarding right to counsel, finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver. Court questions Defendant on receipt of Revocation Order and Warrant. State advises of victim notification, makes sentencing recommendations. Defendant makes statement. Court imposes sentence.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on January 24, 2018 at 10:00 am.
Call from the Public Defender's office indicating Michael Turrittin does not qualify for representation.  Defendant is asking for a hearing ASAP.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: for Sentence Modification - Defendant requesting huber. Per Court, approved. Already approved this on 5/5/17 (see attached).

for Sentence Modification - Defendant requests good time. Per Court, denied. I did NOT allow good time on your sentence, as it is all a condition of probation, not a straight sentence. There is no good time available.
from DOC requesting that Court lift stay on jail time. Per Court, stay lifted. 60 days to begin April 26, 2017.

Defendant Michael L Turrittin in court with attorney Peter Raymond Heyne. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State advises of plea agreement. Court reviews charge, max. penalties, elements. Defendant enters guilty plea. Court questions Defendant on rights and repeater status, finds plea made freely and voluntarily, accepts plea, and finds Defendant guilty. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendations. Defendant makes statement. Bond no longer in effect.

Defendant Michael L Turrittin in court with attorney Peter Raymond Heyne. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense requests one additional adjournment, hasn't had a chance to meet with his client. Bond continues as is.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 5, 2017 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Michael L Turrittin appeared by phone. Attorney Peter Raymond Heyne appeared in Court. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense advises that case is resolved, requests plea/sentencing. Bond continues as is.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 13, 2017 at 09:00 am.
